note.note-paragraph:
In this subclass, the following words are used with the meanings indicated:
- "Wind motor" means a mechanism for converting the energy of
natural wind into useful mechanical power, and the
transmission of such power to its point of use;
- "Rotor" means the wind-engaging parts of the wind motor and
the rotary member carrying them;
- "Rotations axis" means the axis of rotation of the rotor.

title-part.text: Wind motors with rotation axis substantially in wind direction

reference.text: fixing wind engaging part to rotor F03D1/0658

title-part.text: having stationary wind-guiding means, e.g. with shrouds or channels

CPC-specific-text.text: of the whole rotor, i.e. form features of the rotor unit
of the section profile of the blades
characterised by their construction, i.e. structural design details
of the section profile of the blades

title-part.text: Wind motors with rotation axis substantially at right-angles to wind direction

CPC-specific-text.text: or means stationary only with respect to the current wind direction
having stationary guiding vanes surrounding the rotor
with augmenting action, i.e. the guiding means intercepting an area greater than the effective rotor area
having shield means on one side of the rotor
fixed with respect to rotor, orientable together
and only with concentrating action, i.e. only increasing the airflow speed into the rotor
with augmenting action, i.e. the shield means intercepting an area greater than the effective rotor area
orientable with respect to the rotor
and only with concentrating action, i.e. only increasing the airflow speed into the rotor
with augmenting action, i.e. the shield means intercepting an area greater than the effective rotor area
Fixing wind engaging parts to rest of rotor
the wind engaging parts having no movement relative to the rotor during its rotation
the wind engaging parts having a cyclic movement relative to the rotor during its rotation
the cyclic relative movement being coupled to the movement of rotation; Controlling same, e.g. according to wind direction or force
Wind motors having a single vane which axis generate a conus or like surface

title-part.text: the wind-engaging parts being attached to endless chains or the like
the wind-engaging parts being attached to carriages running on tracks or the like
the wind-engaging parts swinging to-and-fro and not rotating
the wind motors having rotation axis substantially in wind direction

CPC-specific-text.text: for orientation in relation to wind direction
the rotating axis changing to vertical position
Adjusting aerodynamic properties of the blades

reference.text: with aerodynamic drag devices on the blades for braking F03D7/0252

CPC-specific-text.text: by changing the active surface of the wind engaging parts, e.g. reefing, telescoping, furling or coning
by mechanical means acting on the power train
with aerodynamic drag devices on the blades

reference.text: adjusting the blades in stall position F03D7/0224

CPC-specific-text.text: for stopping or in emergency situation
by measures acting on the electrical generator

reference.text: controlling electric generator per se H02P

CPC-specific-text.text: Controlling rotor speed, e.g. variable speed
in relation to the state of the electric grid

reference.text: supplying or distributing electric power H02J

CPC-specific-text.text: to prevent instantaneous damage to any part of the motor
to prevent, counteract or reduce vibration or noise
by means of a mechanical governor
by means of an electrical or electronic controller
characterised by the type of control logic
with learning or adaptive control, e.g. self-tuning, fuzzy logic or neural network
characterised by the controller architecture, e.g. multiple processors or data communications

title-part.text: the wind motors having rotation axis substantially at right angle to wind direction
Adaptations of wind motors for special use
Combinations of wind motors with apparatus driven thereby

CPC-specific-text.text: the apparatus being a pump or compressor; Producing under- or overpressure
the apparatus being an electrical generator

reference.text: F03D9/021 takes precedence; details of electrical generators specifically adapted to wind turbines H02K7/183

CPC-specific-text.text: connected to an electrical general supply grid; Arrangements therefor
the wind motor being part of a wind farm
Adaptations for producing heat, e.g. in heat pump systems
the wind motor being combined with means for converting solar radiation into useful energy
the wind motor being combined with water energy converters, e.g. a water turbine

title-part.text: Details, component parts, or accessories not provided for in, or of interest apart from, the preceding groups

reference.text: lubricating of machines in general F01M; bearings per se F16C

CPC-specific-text.text: Arrangement of components within nacelle or tower
Measures to avoid shadow flicker on surroundings

title-part.text: Transmission of power, e.g. using hollow exhausting blades

CPC-specific-text.text: Foundations specifically suited for wind motors
